intro: Farsetia assadii, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Farsetia assadii is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat destruction.
